title: Florent Descombe 2016 Cuvée M  (Moulin-à-Vent)
description: Négociant Florent Descombe has produced a range of cru Beaujolais, including this one. Sourced from vines on the slope of Moulin-à-Vent, it is firm and packed with tannins. There is no compromise in the rich structure that permeates the ripe black fruit. Drink from 2019.

title: Fontanabianca 2014  Barbaresco
description: Heady scents of pressed violet, tilled soil, perfumed berry, new leather and a balsamic note of camphor flow out of the glass. Vibrant and linear, the medium-bodied palate evokes juicy Marasca cherry, ripe raspberry, licorice and crushed mint framed in taut, refined tannins. Bright acidity lends balance. Drink through 2026.

title: François Lurton 2014 Hacienda Araucano Clos de Lolol Single Vineyard Red (Lolol Valley)
description: Cool black-fruit aromas are solid, a bit oaky and show nothing that's unnecessary. A fully extracted palate with moderately hard tannins is where you'll find herbal black-fruit flavors along with tobacco and spice notes. A dry finish is firm and peppery. Drink through 2023.
designation: Hacienda Araucano Clos de Lolol Single Vineyard

title: Hall 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Among the winery's larger offerings, this wine doesn't hold back on quality, offering tight-grained tannin expression around rounded flavors of plum compote, blackberry bramble, cedar and clove. Bright, focused acidity tempers the ripeness and underlying richness, making for a welcome drinking experience.

title: Hall 2014 Craig's Red (Napa Valley)
description: This blends 65% Cabernet Sauvignon with 35% Merlot, the two playing well against each other to provide a broad soft expanse of decadent flavor. Cherry, plum, vanilla and well-integrated oak make it round and opulent, with a fleshiness that persists through a lengthy finish.

title: Heritance 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Chocolate mocha caramel flavors contribute a deep sense of richness in they approachable, well-rounded wine, a testament to the appellation's dusty nature and embrace of black cherry.

title: Hermann Moser 2016 Ried Gebling Reserve HannaH Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)
description: Friendly ripe yellow pear notes perfume the nose of this wine. That generous fruitiness continues on the rounded, pear-driven and juicy palate. The body is cushioned with all of this fruit but remains streamlined and bright thanks to vivid lemon notes.

title: Imagery 2016 Upper Ridge Estate Riesling (Pine Mountain-Cloverdale Peak)
description: This wine is pretty in honeysuckle and honeycomb aromas, featuring beautifully resolved acidity in a dry, welcoming context. Spicy lemon is bracing before it mellows, allowing room for green apple and pear.

title: Jessie's Grove 2013 Petite Sirah (Lodi)
description: This dramatic and inky-colored wine has tight aromas of pencil lead, blackberry and mint followed by extremely concentrated flavors like berries, black cherries and black pepper, but with lighter floral accents, too. The structure is huge due to very firm tannins and robust alcohol, so the wine needs time to mellow. Best after 2022.

title: Josef Bauer 2016 Ried Losling Reserve Riesling (Wagram)
description: The nose of this wine just hints at lemon, but the palate is brimming with fruit. Its lemon sherbet and yellow plum notes are boosted by a dollop of residual sweetness and countered by a zesty freshness that helps it finish dry. A lovely, fruity and very refreshing wine.

title: Lafond 2015 SRH Riesling (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Very fresh and crisp on the sip, this bottling shows lively lime flavors, steely minerality, citrus blossoms and pomelo pith, and is reminiscent of a crisp summer morning. It's tightly wound on the palate, where vibrant lime and orange-peel flavors hang from a chalky texture, with Asian pear, Meyer lemon, tangerine and petrol toward the finish.

title: Laurent Gauthier 2016 Grand Cras Vieilles Vignes  (Morgon)
description: Firm tannins mark this wine out for a good future. Its structure and generous fruits are slowly developing, promising richness as it matures. A dense wine packed with both fruit and tannins, it will be ready from 2019.

title: Lavau 2014  Condrieu
description: Candied orange peel and dried apricot are accented by heady notes of vanilla, cream and spice in this opulent wine. Three years after bottling, it reveals spicy potpourri notes of maturation, but plenty of fresh tangerine and peach remain. Rich and rounded, it's a lavish wine with a long, slightly warming finish.

title: Mayer am Pfarrplatz 2016 Nussberg White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)
description: A tropical suggestion of passion fruit plays with the pear notes on the nose of this zesty Viennese field blend. Freshness and texture are key, imbuing the slender body with zesty, aromatic tangerine-laden depth This is enlivening, aromatic and bold, with a refreshing dry finish.

title: Miner 2013 The Oracle Red (Napa Valley)
description: Sourced primarily from Stagecoach Vineyard on Atlas Peak and blended with a small amount of Oakville Vineyard grapes, this is a blend of 57% Cabernet Sauvignon and 22% Cabernet Franc, with small percentages of Merlot, Petit Verdot and Malbec. Big, tannic and overpowering in its youth, it reveals hints of cedar, pencil shavings and sage, with a rich black-cherry core. Enjoy 2023–2033.

title: Mommessin 2016 Château de Pierreux  (Brouilly)
description: This wine comes from the grand estate of Pierreux with its handsome château. Rich and fruity, it has a spicy, vanilla character from aging in wooden vats. With its ripe black-plum and damson flavors, the wine is smooth and generous, ready to drink now.

title: Naggiar 2015 Estate Grown Grenache (Sierra Foothills)
description: This medium-bodied wine has an appetizing lip-smacking texture and a rather taut balance that could take on a wide variety of food pairings. It's all fresh berry and cherry flavors, snappy acidity and firm tannins.

title: Panzanello 2013 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: A blend of 95% Sangiovese and 5% Cabernet Sauvignon, this opens with aromas of iris, red plum and baking spice. The juicy, fragrant palate doles out ripe black cherry, white pepper, star anise and tobacco while fine-grained, polished tannins provide support. Enjoy through 2028.

title: Rogue Vine 2014 Super Itata Red (Itata Valley)
description: If you want to try noninterventional wine from Itata, Rogue Vine is a good place to start. This blend of Malbec, Carignan and Syrah opens with leathery blueberry aromas graced by mocha. A smacking palate is tannic and firm but not mean. Intense cassis, tobacco and spice flavors finish flush and saturated.

title: Steininger 2016 Ried Kittmannsberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)
description: The scent of freshly cut Conference pear peels combines with crisp, green apple notes in this wine. The palate shows the characteristic, yeastiness that shimmers with saltiness, but juicy pear fruit plays the starring role. The finish is totally moreish.

title: Tamarack Cellars 2013 Sagemoor Vineyard Reserve Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Coming from one of the state's top vineyards, this wine is a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon (78%), Cabernet Franc (10%), 7% Petit Verdot and Merlot. The aromas are tightly wound on first pour, with pleasing notes of red and black fruit, along with plum, mocha, herb, flower and spice. The flavors are pitch black, soft and silky in feel with highly structured, ever so slightly dry tannins that smooth out with some time open. This one needs additional time. Best after 2021.

title: Tenuta di Lilliano 2014 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this opens with aromas of black-skinned berry, new leather and eucalyptus. The concentrated palate offers ripe black cherry, blackberry jam, tobacco and licorice alongside brooding tannins. Drink 2018–2027.

title: Tenuta San Mauro 2004 Canova Riserva  (Barbaresco)
description: Underbrush, crushed mint, leather, a whiff of tar and a hint of toast lead the nose. The palate is accessible but still fresh, offering dried Marasca cherry, black raspberry and baking spice framed in velvety tannins. Drink through 2024.

title: Trinity Hill 2014 Homage Syrah (Hawke's Bay)
description: This is big yet approachable wine with many years ahead of it. There's mocha, black cherry, soy sauce and violet tones wrapped in structured, mouth-filling tannins, plenty of acidity and an umami finish. Drink now–2032.

title: Undurraga 2014 T.H.Terroir Hunter Pinot Noir (Leyda Valley)
description: A dark color and leathery, spicy, musky aromas lead to a medium to full palate with boldness and balance. Spiced cherry and black-plum flavors are lasting on a finish in which moderately complex fruit and spice flavors fade away with grace.

title: Uphill Vineyards 2013 Estate Grown Tempranillo (Amador County)
description: Very good concentration and a sleek texture make this medium to full-bodied wine from the Sierra Foothills easy to appreciate. It has layers of ripe black fruits, nuances of toasted oak and cedar, and fine-grained tannins that provide good backbone.

title: Valdivieso 2013 Caballo Loco Grand Cru Limarí Syrah (Limarí Valley)
description: Rawness and aromas of tree bark, tomato and spice form the greeting on this Limarí Syrah that spanks the palate with scratchy gravelly tannins and acidity. Flavors of red plum and currant are earthy, while some oak character is found on a rugged finish. Drink through 2024.

title: Yohan Lardy 2015 Vieilles Vignes de 1903  (Moulin-à-Vent)
description: Beaujolais holds many old vineyards, but this one sets a record at 114 years. This wine is firm and concentrated, with wood aging giving a minty character as well as a dry core, . Low-yielding vines bring richness and a solid texture that will repay another few months aging. Drink from mid-2018.

title: Casa Donoso 2014 Grand Domaine Red (Maule Valley)
description: Floral aromas of violet petal blend with berry and cassis notes to form a fruity pleasant nose. This blend of 60% Carmenère and 40% Malbec features tight tannins that create a downward pull on the palate. Baked plum and spice flavors are fairly straightforward on a lasting finish. Drink through 2023.

title: Casa Smith 2015 Porcospino Northridge Vineyard Primitivo (Wahluke Slope)
description: Coming from a vineyard that is increasingly establishing its prominence, fruit-forward aromas of plum, boysenberry, dried herb, spice and moist earth are followed by saturated sumptuous blue and red-fruit flavors. It's undeniable in its appeal at a price that can't be beat.
